Customer Newsletter
July 2009 edition:
New Customers and New Upgrades

Risk -- Wall Builder/ADAM: Denton Wilde Sapte LLP Troutman Sanders LLP Wilmer Hale, LLP

IntApp Going Virtual
Last year at ILTA, we announced the virtualization of our entire product line. Clients are continuing to make the transition to IntApp's virtualized, software-only product line.
Through the end of the year, IntApp is offering a Hardware Buy Back Program to encourage clients to make the move and reduce their hardware footprint. For more information, please email Neal.Vora@intapp.com.
Virtualizing Firms: Becker & Poliakoff, P.A. Bradley Arant Boult Cummings LLP Haynes and Boone, LLP
ILTA 2009
We're eagerly anticipating connecting with clients, partners and prospective customers at ILTA 2009. For the fifth consecutive year, IntApp has been selected to present as part of ILTA's state-of-the-art technology showcase. Our staff will also be presenting at two panels this year:
"Can Risk Management Help Grow a Firm's Profitability, Even in Extreme Financial Conditions?" - Pat Archbold, VP Risk Management Practice - 8/27/2009 10:30 am
"Automation, Automation, Automation: Business Process Management and Workflows" - Warren Knowles, Sr. Product Manager - 8/24/2009 2:30 pm
Once again, we'll also be presenting product and client showcase videos on the in-room TV channels. Come visit us at Booth #314/316.
Our Fourth Annual ILTA Wine Tasting is also in the works, watch for your invitations in the mail. If you're a client that has registered to attend ILTA but (understandably) opted out of having your name distributed to vendors, we want to make sure we don't forget to invite you, so please email Lea.Simon@intapp.com.
Announcing Integration Builder 4.2
IntApp is pleased to announce the newest release of Integration Builder. This update includes over five new features and more than fifteen improvements to existing functionality, including:
-Streamlined methods for working for multi-server systems
-UI improvements to enable users to more quickly migrate integrations from development to production systems
-Smarter integration event logic to enhance performance and efficiency of Integration Builder integrations
Additionally, the library of pre-built integration templates available on the IntApp Resource Center continues to grow with new templates for Carpe Diem and for generating billing reports from common time and billing systems.
IntApp supporting Legal Aid
We are pleased to announce that IntApp has made a software donation to The Legal Aid Society, a not for profit organization dedicated to providing legal services to the impoverished.
We are very excited to be contributing to an organization that does such important work. For more information about the Legal Aid Society, visit www.legal-aid.org.
IntApp Webinars
We ran a webinar featuring Matt Carr, IT Director at Woodcock Washburn, and Chris Kave, Principal of Aurora North Software this quarter. The webinar focused on using IntApp's Integration Builder in conjunction with Microsoft SharePoint and a standardized master data architecture to streamline workflow processes. If you missed the webinar, you can view the presentation on our website at http://www.intapp.com/products/ibwebinars.html.
We also ran a webinar about recent ABA changes to Model Rule 1.10. The webinar featured a panel of industry experts including Lucian Pera, President of Association of Professional Responsibility Lawyers (APRL); Partner at Adams and Reese LLP, Deborah Jeffrey, Partner, Professional Services Practice Group at Zuckerman Spaeder LLP, AnneMarie Davine, Managing Director at Marsh and Pat Archbold, VP of Risk Management Practice at IntApp. Given the interest in the topic, we will be holding a repeat session in conjunction with Thomson West on August 13th. If you missed the first event or would like to refer a colleague, the registration page can be found at http://tinyurl.com/WestWebinar.
We would also like to thank Deborah Jeffrey for her contribution of a brief commentary of the issues raised in the Risk Roundtable webinar. Her commentary can be found on our website at http://www.intapp.com/company/news20090724.html.
IntApp Receives Telly Award for Time Builder Video
We are pleased to announce that IntApp has been recognized as a winner in the 30th annual Telly Awards for our Time Builder Product Overview video.
The Telly Awards honor the very best local, regional, and cable television commercials and programs, as well as the finest video and film productions, and work created for the Web.
For more information on the Telly Awards, visit www.tellyawards.com.
